New Records: This is the lowest total ever defended against India in a T20I, and the lowest against anyone in Harare.
Key Match Events: Tendai Chatara and Sikandar Raza picked three wickets each as India collapsed.
Ravi Bishnoi took a T20 career-best of 4 for 13.
India lost four wickets inside five overs.
Zimbabwe bowled India out for 102 in 19.5 overs.
India needed 16 off the final over with one wicket in hand but Chatara bowled a nerveless 20th over, conceding just two runs and claiming Washington Sundar's wicket.
Zimbabwe's unbroken last-wicket stand of 25 between Clive Madande and Chatara proved crucial.
Pre-Game Insights: India handed debuts to Abhishek Sharma, Riyan Parag, and Dhruv Jurel.
India's first-choice squad was getting some time off a week on from the World Cup final in Bridgetown.
Miscellaneous Highlights: Harare Sports Club was packed to the rafters.
This was Zimbabwe's first win against India in any format since 2016.
This was just Zimbabwe's third win in nine T20Is this year.
